title: 17-year-old refuses to babysit 27-year-old sister's 3 children aged 6, 4, and 2 years old after sister says jokes that she's “basically a live-in nanny”: ‘I was so mad that I decided right then and there that I was done’
description: If you've ever looked at moving away from your hometown family, you'll hear a lot from your relatives about how it's going to be harder living somewhere away from them and without the "family support system." Those who are of an age where they might be considering having children will hear a lot of this. Particularly from expectant would-be grandparents who don't want their grandchildren growing up somewhere away from them.While this might seem like a scam to keep you nearby, they have a legitimate point. It really is a lot harder when you're living somewhere without close family nearby, and it's important to remember here that as soon as kids enter the picture, the phrase "family support system" really means one thing: free child care. (Story continues below)This is something people tend to take for granted when they have it. Like this older sister did in a story shared by her younger sister to this popular online community. See, it's really hard to convince people to look after your children, even if they are of your own flesh and family.
author: Brad Dickson
excerpt: 17-year-old refuses to babysit 27-year-old sister's 3 children aged 6, 4, and 2 years old after sister says jokes that she's “basically a live-in nanny”: ‘I was so mad that I decided right then and there that I was done’ - The internet has generated a huge amount of laughs from cats and FAILS. And we all out of cats.
text: And paying for childcare is extremely expensive and seldom has overnight care options unless you have a babysitter you really trust but, again, that relies on some kind of social connection. There's a reason it's so challenging and expensive. Looking after kids is a lot of work and a constant process that few would willingly subject themselves to.But, if you do live near family and they're helping you with your children for free, you'd be mighty foolish to throw away a good thing and jeopardize that over something so petty as impolite comments directed toward them. But that's what this older sister did, causing her younger sister to rescind the privileges of her time that she had been offering.
html:
And paying for childcare is extremely expensive and seldom has overnight care options unless you have a babysitter you really trust but, again, that relies on some kind of social connection. There's a reason it's so challenging and expensive. Looking after kids is a lot of work and a constant process that few would willingly subject themselves to.

But, if you do live near family and they're helping you with your children for free, you'd be mighty foolish to throw away a good thing and jeopardize that over something so petty as impolite comments directed toward them. But that's what this older sister did, causing her younger sister to rescind the privileges of her time that she had been offering.
